net.cloud.server.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.util.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends Object
    Contains, as the name implies, String utility functions.

    • Method Detail

      • upperFirst

        public static String upperFirst(String text)
        Formats a string of text to be upper case letter first, and then lower case. The upper case will be put for the first letter after any spaces, too. Also, underscores are replaced with spaces.
        This is the inverse of allCaps(text)
        Parameters:
        text - The text to format
        Returns:
        A formatted string

      • allCaps

        public static String allCaps(String text)
        Format a string of text into the all capitals format. This means all characters are uppercase, and spaces are represented as underscores.
        This is the inverse of upperFirst(text)
        Parameters:
        text - The text to format
        Returns:
        A formatted string

      • getFromBuffer

        public static String getFromBuffer(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Get a terminated String from a ByteBuffer. This will move the pos in the buffer. The string terminator is the TERMINATOR constant character.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The Buffer to read from.
        Returns:
        The String of chars from the start pos to the pos of the first TERMINATOR char.

      • getFromBuffer

        public static String getFromBuffer(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        A variant that uses the Netty ByteBuf rather than the NIO ByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the string from
        Returns:
        A string from the data in the buffer

      • getFromRAF

        public static String getFromRAF(RandomAccessFile raf)
                         throws IOException
        A variant that uses a RandomAccessFile directly rather than a memory mapped buffer
        Parameters:
        raf - The file to get the string from
        Returns:
        The string read from the file
        Throws:
        IOException - If could not read from file

      • writeStringToBuffer

        public static void writeStringToBuffer(String string,
                                       ByteBuffer buffer)
        Write a String to a ByteBuffer, terminating it with TERMINATOR. This can be in turn read back with StringUtil.getFromBuffer(ByteBuffer)
        Parameters:
        string - The text to write
        buffer - The buffer to write to.

      • writeStringToBuffer

        public static void writeStringToBuffer(String string,
                                       io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Write a String to a ByteBuf, terminating it with TERMINATOR. This can be in turn read back with StringUtil.getFromBuffer(ByteBuffer)
        Parameters:
        string - The text to write
        buffer - The buffer to write to.

      • getNumBytesInString

        public static int getNumBytesInString(String string)
        Parameters:
        string - The string
        Returns:
        The number of bytes this string will occupy when written out

      • getBytesFromHex

        public static byte[] getBytesFromHex(String hex)
        Parses a hexadecimal literal string into an array of bytes.
        Ex: "1F2A" = {31, 42}
        Parameters:
        hex - The hexadecimal literal (Must be of even length)
        Returns:
        An array of bytes, matching the hex value.

      • extractCommandToken

        public static String extractCommandToken(StringBuilder sb)
                                  throws ParseException
        Figure out what the next token is in a command string, and return it. The token is removed from the StringBuilder, so the first character, if any remain, will be the one immediately following the token. Leading whitespace is removed.
        The token is defined to be either the block of characters between the beginning of the string and the next space, or the block of characters between a set of quotation marks.
        Ex: ' word' returns 'word', and '"multiple words here"' returns 'multiple words here'
        Parameters:
        sb - The StringBuilder containing the string to parse
        Returns:
        The next token in the string, as defined.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the StringBuilder contained no token, or quotations were mismatched

      • trimLeadingSpaces

        public static void trimLeadingSpaces(StringBuilder sb)
        Remove spaces from the beginning of the StringBuilder
        Parameters:
        sb - The StringBuilder to trim

      • isAlphaNumeric

        public static boolean isAlphaNumeric(String s)
        Check to see if a string contains only alphabetical, numerical, or underscore characters.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to test
        Returns:
        True if the string matches

      • isAlphaNumericSpecial

        public static boolean isAlphaNumericSpecial(String s)
        Check to see if a string contains only alphabetical, numerical, underscore, or the special characters from the number keys.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to test
        Returns:
        True if the string matches
